2024-2025 Shepherd University Catalog

Recreation and Sport Studies Comprehensive, B.S.

Print-Friendly Page (opens a new window)
Facebook this Page (opens a new window)
Tweet this Page (opens a new window)

Shepherd University offers a comprehensive major in recreation and sport studies that prepares students for a variety of recreation, sport, and leisure careers. In addition to the required core courses of study, each student is required to select at least one of the following concentrations:

Interscholastic Athletic Administration and Coaching (was Athletic Coaching and Officiating)

The concentration in Interscholastic Athletic Administration and Coaching is designed to develop and enhance competencies necessary for coaching of athletics in a public school setting or in higher education, administration of athletic programs at a secondary or higher education level, and management in a community or professional sport organization. The program represents a blend of content related to the art of coaching and administration of athletics.

Sport Communication

This concentration prepares students for careers in sport broadcasting, sport reporting, free-lance sport writing, sport promotions/marketing, sport fund raising, sport information, and public relations.

Sport and Event Management

This concentration prepares students for management positions in a variety of settings including professional and semiprofessional sports, sport and recreation organizations, YMCAs, and public recreation and parks in such areas as ticket operations, stadium or facilities management, event coordination, marketing, community relations, corporate and group sales, and recreation supervision.

Sports Marketing

This concentration is designed to give students a broad background in marketing and sport-related marketing in addition to a strong foundation in recreation and sport.

Recreation Therapy (was Therapeutic Recreation)

This concentration prepares students for the NCTRC exam, which certifies individuals as Certified Therapeutic Recreation Specialists (CTRS). Certified therapeutic recreation majors are employed by hospitals, nursing homes, health care agencies, alternative schools, group homes, camps, and other settings dealing with handicapped, disabled, and impaired individuals. .

 

Outâ€‘ofâ€‘Class and Progression Requirements for Recreation and Sport Studies Majors

The following requirements must be met for graduation:

  1. It is REQUIRED that each major be an active member of an approved state or national organization in his or her specialization during the academic years while pursuing this major;
  2. It is REQUIRED that all recreation majors attend two or more state and/or national conferences in their concentration during the academic years while pursuing this major.
  3. It is REQUIRED that each student develop a portfolio of their academic work beginning with their freshman year. Portfolio is to be completed by the student during their senior year.
  4. It is REQUIRED that each student earn a minimum of C in each recreation and sport studies core and concentration class.

Recreation and Sport Studies Program Learning Outcomes:

  1. Students graduating from the program shall demonstrate the following entry-level knowledge: a) the nature and scope of the relevant park, recreation, tourism or related professions and their associated industries; b) techniques and processes used by professionals and workers in these industries; and c) the foundation of the profession in history, science and philosophy.
     
  2. Students graduating from the program shall be able to demonstrate the ability to design, implement, and evaluate services that facilitate targeted human experiences and that embrace personal and cultural dimensions of diversity.
     
  3. Students graduating from the program shall be able to demonstrate entry-level knowledge about operations and strategic management/administration in parks, recreation, tourism and/or related professions.
     
  4. Students graduating from the program shall demonstrate, through a comprehensive internship of not less than 400 clock hours and no fewer than 10 weeks, the potential to succeed as professionals at supervisory or higher levels in park, recreation, tourism, or related organizations.

 

 

Curriculum for a Comprehensive Major in Recreation and Sport Studies

Total hours required (including free electives), 120 Hours:

Core Curriculum requirements, 42 Hours:

Concentration, 27-30 Hours:

Electives, 9-15 Hours:

At least 2 of these hours must be upper division (300-400 level).

Major core requirements, 45 Hours:

  • RECR 140 - Introduction to Recreation and Sport Studies (3cr)
  • RECR 200 - Recreation and Sport Management Technology (3 cr)
  • RECR 201 - Sport Finance (3 cr)
  • RECR 211 - Leadership in Recreation and Sport (3 cr)
  • RECR 300 - Risk Management in Recreation and Sport (3cr)
  • RECR 316 - Recreational and Sports Programming (3cr)
  • RECR 320 - Facilities Management (3 cr)
  • RECR 336 - Inclusive Recreation (3 cr)
  • RECR 350 - Field Experience in Recreation and Sport Services (3 cr)

  •  

  • RECR 370 - Environmental Education (3 cr)
  • OR  RECR 371 - Outdoor Education (3cr)

  •  

  • RECR 407 - Management in Recreation and Sport (3cr)
  • OR (Therapeutic Recreation ONLY)  RECR 436 - Therapy for Mental Health Conditions (3cr)


  •  

  • RECR 444 - Design and Analysis Research in Recreation and Sport (3 cr)
  • RECR 450 - Recreation Internship (9 cr)

Concentrations (Select one of the following):

Interscholastic Athletic Administration and Coaching Concentration

Required courses, 27 Hours:

  • RECR 226 - Sports Marketing (3 cr)
  • ATHC 300 - Sports Officiating (3cr)
  • ATHC 302 - Recreation and Sport Administration (3cr)
  • ATHC 303 - Principles of Coaching (3 cr)
  • ATHC 324 - Care and Prevention of Athletic Injuries (3cr)
  • RECR 350 - Field Experience in Recreation and Sport Services (3 cr)
  • ATHC 402 - Legal Aspects of Recreation and Sport (3cr)
  • ATHC 405 - Psychology of Coaching (3 cr)
  • HLTH 468 - Principles of Sports Nutrition (3 cr)

Four-Year Course Progression

Recreation and Sport Studies, Interscholastic Athletic Administration and Coaching Concentration (Internship)

Recreation Therapy Concentration

Required courses, 27 Hours:

  • RECR 250 - Field Experience in Recreation (3 cr)
  • RECR 331 - Medical Terminology for Therapeutic Recreation (3 cr)
  • HLTH 375 - Applied Anatomy and Physiology (3cr)
  • RECR 422 - Admin & Supervision of Therapeutic Recreation (3cr)
  • RECR 430 - Therapeutic Recreation Programming (3 cr)
  • RECR 435 - Therapy for Physical Health Conditions (3cr)
  • RECR 443 - Contemporary Issues in Therapeutic Recreation (3cr)
  • PSYC 309 - Psychopathology (3 cr)
  • PSYC 340 - Lifespan Developmental Psychology (3 cr)

Free electives, 1-5 Hours

Four-Year Course Progression

Free electives, 3-5 Hours

Sport Marketing Concentration

Required courses, 15 Hours:

  • RECR 226 - Sports Marketing (3 cr)
  • RECR 228 - Sport Management (3 cr)
  • BADM 310 - Principles of Management (3 cr)
  • BADM 340 - Principles of Marketing (3cr)
  • BADM 395 - Consumer Behavior (3 cr)

Free electives, 1-5 Hours

Four-Year Course Progression

Recreation and Leisure Studies, Sport Marketing (Internship)
